lead_paragraph: In an attempt to stem the use of steroids among high school athletes, the N.F.L. launched a $1.2 million education program yesterday. Working through eight teams, the two-pronged program, called Atlas for boys and Athena for girls, is expected to reach 20,000 students in 40 high schools during this school year.
